content.question: Compared to letter B, what melodic feature is present at letter C? (Note that the horns in F sound a perfect fifth lower than notated and the trumpets in B-flat sound a major second lower than notated.)

choices.label: Melodic transposition up a major second
Melodic transposition up a minor third
Melodic transposition up a perfect fourth

content.answer: Melodic transposition up a major second

unit.text: 2: Music Fundamentals II - Minor Scales and Key Signatures, Melody, Timbre, and Texture

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Use symbols and terms to describe and apply procedures for melodic and rhythmic transformation in notated music.
